dcterms:description: The developing Human Connectome Project (dHCP) includes T1w and T2w MRIs of newborns imaged without sedation on a 3 T Philips Achieva scanner. It provides 0.5 mm isotropic de-faced scans of individuals imaged postnatally between 24 to 45 weeks post-conceptional age.
dcterms:title: Developing Human Connectome Project (dHCP)

dcterms:description: The Melbourne Children’s Regional Infant Brain (M-CRIB) atlas is constructed from T2w MRI and corresponding manual segmentations of healthy term-born neonates. The atlas comprises 94 neonatal brain regions compatible with the widely-used Desikan-Killiany-Tourville adult cortical atlas.
dcterms:title: Melbourne Children’s Regional Infant Brain (M-CRIB) atlas
